reviews.sentence: I love Prague and it was great to stay in your hotel. Good location with proximity of sight seeing shopping and dinning. Great accessibility by any mean of transport. Generous size of room and memorable and helpful staff. Acor treatment wend definitely over and beyond with extra discount on FampB I have enjoyed buffet lunches in restaurant. Rooms are bit modest but very comfortable. There are detail which can definitely can be polished. Building show its age in public areas wooden paneling in restaurant and on corridors require some maintenance found soft spots on floor. Unexpected was to find plastic glasses in bathroom looks cheap. Also waiting staff was not real concentrated on job I saw quite lot of them but they were often hanging around and chatting not paying attention to guest. They set me up dirty cutlery on other occasion I had to wait good 10 minutes to bring me some. First day cook at station in restaurant look to be stressed and not really comfortable he could communicate better. Next day new one was just perfect and helpful. On welcome card left in room my Acor status was wrong I´m not particularly picky about it it´s how attention on details is Originally I booked room with two single beds expecting company so I was surprised automatically getting king size bed. As planes changed and I came alone I would be kind asking for it it would be good to get first booked room set up. Wifi was working very well good job there.
The stay was ok but the rooms were very tired and could do with a big Reno.

I am a very loyal customer who comes to your hotel for years as you can see in your records. In general I liked the new renovated rooms but unfortunately you had the same mistake to work with an architect who has no idea about the ergonomie. If you use your tab in the new bathroom you will see how uncomfortable it is to wash the face and how it makes wet all new furniture in wood which will be soon perished. To clean this bathroom furniture should be a nightmare for your housekeepers and you should definitely increase their salary because this intelligent architect. Last but not least you renovate a room. You make it much nicer but you use plastic glace in the bathroom may be for hygiene but believe it make very cheap and kills the class that you try to create.

We were delighted with the historical and notably meaningful humanistic character of your impressive hotel and we enjoyed very much its comfort and especially the warmth of your very hospitable amiable and intelligent staff whenever and wherever we met them. Our room No 327 was comfortable and very clean quiet well aerated and well lit nicely and tastefully renovated and decorated although the bathroom was somewhat narrow as was the closet warderobe. Breakfast was tasty and with a rich choice of food and beverages cold and warm even if a bit recurrent for our one week sojourn. It would be nice if the furniture in the lobby were renovated so as to provide more comfort in addition to its classical style. All in all we were very pleased with the excellent location and high quality of the hotel and its people staf and guests alike. Please transmit our deep gratitude especially to your most friendly patient and helpful staff at the reception desk and to the very considerate intelligent and polite bell boys.

Checkin very slow and made even slower as the front desk could not find any record of the package I had booked which included late checkout. Although granted when I produced my confirmation and I did not even need a late checkout in the end it is a bit of an unpleasant way to start my stay that I have to go digging through my e mails for proof of what I had bought. The remodeling work is very obviously only partially done hopefully to be completed soon as the new style is much better overall and also fits the brand and the price point much better. I am glad we had a remodeled room it was very niceBreakfast room particularly could really use a fresh design and the waiting staff seemed a bit lost at times. When it got busy tables were not cleared of dirty dishes anymore. The coffee service execution was very strange even when it was not so busy. why bring me a single initial mug of black coffee when I have to then go fetch milk and refills myself. Some people were brought milk by the staff and some even refills of coffee but it looked to me like most were not and the staff certainly were not making any offers to us. Otherwise breakfast was good and had all the necessary basics and I did appreciated the made to order omelettes.

Very slow check in no upgrade was proposed even if the hotel had free better room categories than the one I had reserved. I had to ask for an upgrade as a benefit of being Platinum member and after a long negociation with the front desk officer it was approved an upgrade was proposed to the couple before us even they had a lower loyality level silver. The room was excellent renovated and very clean. We had an electricity cut during our stay for 2 hours and the hotel was under renovation it was not communicated to us when we booked our stay. The breakfast is awsome and the restaurant staff is incredible. I would maybe recomand this hotel if my check in experience was better during our last stay in Prague in the Radison Blu our gold membership benefits were honored and this was not the case here. What a shame.

Nice hotel great location but could do better. First of all the location is fantastic and we could not have picked a better location. it is handy for everything Old Town has to offer and really easy to get to most other places from. However the overall service and state of the hotel during our visit really let it down. The hotel is impressive and the main reception seems to have been recently renovated. We arrived on Thursday evening and despite there being three check in desks only one member of staff was working. It took us around 30mins of waiting to actually get as far as checking in. The member of staff was however friendly and helpful giving us some ideas of local bars and restaurants to try plus noting down some places of interest on a map. We were given room 51 on the 5th floor a corner room quite cramped with a poor layout. There is a window with a view of a wall but the window did not open. The heat inside the room was stifling and made it impossible to sleep at all as the air con did not work. Next morning I asked to be moved to another room explaining that they could not expect us to sleep in a room with no opening window and no aircon. Initially I was told that the hotel was full but when I asked for a refund and to move hotels a room suddenly became available. This room was on the same floor and luckily had a window that opens. Turns out that none of the aircon in the hotel was working it is all turned off. It took them 3 hours to move us and a bit of an argument but it got sorted in the end. Quite poor customer service though and the staff attitude was not nice at times. There was renovation work going on throughout the hotel and the noise from builders started quite early each morning. Looks like we picked a bad time to stay here and perhaps we should have been warned in advance of the construction renovation works so we could have maybe looked elsewhereit is surely a basic standard to have working air con in the bedrooms as they do seem to be quite small and obviously some of them do not have windows that open. Why it is turned off never quite became clearA buffet style breakfast was included and there is a varied and plentiful choice of dishes on offer. We found that we had to ask the staff to replenish the food they did not seem keen on topping up the food unles absolutely necesaryAlso. no WiFi available during our stay something worth noting for anybody who needs this.

There was no information about the redecoration works inside the hotel during booking. All staircases out of use. Only one working lift. No bar. No fitness room. Generally speaking it will be probably a good hotel but now it is rather a construction yard. It is definately not what you expect from Sofitel brand.

Great location super comfy bed. Perfect location and super comfortable bed. The ability to sleep with window open for fresh air is a blitz when travelling. Looks to be quite recently furnished as there were still some renovations taking place during our stay in various parts of the building along with entrance. Staff are friendly and helpful. Easy to get to from airport catch airport bus 100 then jump on yellow line to Florenc then on arrival as you get out of metro station take a sharp right walk abt 300 m and you are at the hotel.
The room was OK but there was a lot of renovation ongoing in common areas which we were not informed upfront. Bar closed restaurant toilets closed renovation staff running in the lobby.
Beautiful old hotel with updated rooms. Everything was excellent except for breakfast half of the time. We asked for coffee cream each day and only got it twice. Not sure why we were forgotten about.

Nice stay. We stayed at MGalery in June 2016The rooms are small but well appointed and the staff is friendly. We stayed in the newly renovated rooms and the beds were comfortable although the bathroom was really really tiny. The location is amazing and walking distance to the square and other places of interest in the old town. Also lots of trams available near the hotel for exploring the city.

Nice recently refurbished hotel downtown in Prague. The room is spacious enough and everything is clean and in good shape. Very friendly and professional staff. I felt welcomed and was upgraded due to my platinum status. Thanks for that. WiFi connection was not good enough and I had some problems to connect to my office by VPN. Beakfast is OK in quality and variety but i found products were out of stock a couple of days eg scrambled eggs or yoghourt pots were empty and I could not eat those products.

Century long tradition of Czech hospitality. Excellent location newly refurbished rooms diligent and friendly staff at the very heart of Old Prague. What else could one wish in this gorgeous and lively city.

Great room great location restoration services needs improvement. Everything was good quality from the welcome at the reception to the quality of the room small attention to details but your restoration services are not following. The first night I ordered room service and the seafood in my linguine were cold like if they were coming out of the cooler. They were obviously put last minute in the pasta and not cook. The next evening I have decided to try the restaurant. We were maybe 12 people total in the restaurant 8 in a group and 2 solo eaters. After waiting for 20 minutes I received my entree after my entree the waiter advised me that it would take 45 minutes to receive my main course because they were overloaded in the kitchen. After being sited there for an hour I have asked for the check without being able to my main course because I had a conference call to attend. Really not a great experience for both dinner.

MGalery Prague. Located in the centre of the city. Nice large refurbished rooms unles you need twin beds then you get a small room or a queen and a sofa in an executive room. Cleaners were great. They had to be reminded each day to fill the mini bar. Breakfast was lovely and male breakfast staff were great. The female breakfast staff were not.

Great location and newly renovated. Room nicely furnished and newly renovated. The climate control System was not adequate air was very stufyRestaurant. was promised a table for dinner then subsequently told that a Group of 20 was booked and we were not able to have dinner in the restaraunt luckily the restaurant conciege recommended us was FANTASTIC.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It has been well refurbished and we would highly recommend the accommodation. The beds and bedding are very comfortable and gave us good nights sleep. The rooms are kept very clean and well serviced every day. The daily breakfast was excellent and the restaurant staff were very helpful and friendly. If we have one complaint it would be that not all the people working on the front reception desk were welcoming. Some people in particular gave us the impression that we were somewhat of an intrusion into their day.

Good location excellent hotel. Within walking distance to all major attractions in Prague this hotel is perfectly located. Newly renovated the rooms are very pleasant. Bathrooms are on the small side. My only criticism is the dinner menu at the restaurant very small and uninspired. Breakfast is very good indeed for the coffee lovers the coffee is very good indeed. Shal definitely stay here again on our next trip to Prague.

Exclent stay for a city break brilliant location and lovely rooms. Would stay again. Bed was extra comphy. Luxury toiletries refreshed every day. Staff always on hand to help. Transfers avaliable upon request. Amazing location and great priceBreakfast could have been a little better with being refreshed more often as they had sometimes ran out of things when we went up to the buffet. More selection would have been nice.
